folder: Lafayette Street & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Lafayette Street (Elm Street), north from a point slightly south of Broome Street, showing construction work in progress on the Interborough Rapid Transit Co. (I.R.T.) subway. Lafayette Street was created by the joining of Elm Street, which terminated at a point slightly south of Jersey Street with Lafayette Place, which commenced at Great Jones Street. The completed thoroughfare received its present name several years later.

May 6, 1901.

Board of Transportation Photograph.
#William B. Parsons Collection.

folder: Lafayette Street & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Lafayette Street (Elm Street), north from a point between Broome (not shown) and Spring Streets, showing the street being excavated in preparation for the construction of the Interborough Transit Co. (I.R.T.) subway. Lafayette Street was created by the joining of Elm Street; which terminated at a point slightly south of Jersey Street with Lafayette Place, which commenced at Great Jones Street. The completed thoroughfare received its present name several years later.

April 1, 1901.

Board of Transportation Photograph.
William B. Parsons Collection.

folder: Lafayette Street & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
206-214 Lafayette (Elm) Street, west side, between Broome and Spring Streets. No. 210 is a 4-story frame building.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.

(2)
A detail of the same, showing a closer view of No. 210, a 4-story house.

March 16, 1934

P. L. Sperr.

The frame structure, No. 210, has been sold by Jane Van Cleve to an adjoining firm which will occupy same, according to the New York Sun of April 28, 1938 in the first transfer of this property since 1862. The same buyer recently purchased No. 51 Crosby Street, directly to the rear.

folder: Lafayette Street & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
187 Lafayette Street, at the S.E. corner of Broome Street, showing an 8-story loft building. Also shown (left) are Nos. 409 and 407 Broome Street (left) at and adjoining the S.E. corner of Lafayette Street. March 16, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Lafayette Street & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Lafayette Street the southwest corner of Broome Street, showing gasoline station on corner.

2)
241 Lafayette Street, east side, and north of Spring Street.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: July 25, 1939.
View 2: November 2, 1939.
